sections.title: What are fractions?
sections.content: A fraction represents part of a whole. For example, if you have a pizza and you cut it into 4 equal slices, each slice is 1/4 of the whole pizza.

sections.question: Which fraction represents half of a whole?
sections.explanation: 1/2 means one part out of two equal parts. If you cut something into 2 equal pieces, each piece is half of the whole.

sections.title: Numerator and Denominator
sections.content:
In a fraction like 3/4:
- The top number (3) is called the numerator - it tells us how many parts we have
- The bottom number (4) is called the denominator - it tells us how many equal parts the whole is divided into

sections.question: In the fraction 2/5, what does the number 5 represent?
options: The number of parts we have
The total number of equal parts
sections.explanation: In the fraction 2/5, the denominator (5) represents the total number of equal parts that the whole is divided into.

sections.title: Equivalent Fractions
sections.content: Equivalent fractions are different fractions that represent the same value. For example, 1/2, 2/4, and 3/6 are all equivalent fractions because they all represent half of a whole.

sections.question: Which of the following is equivalent to 1/2?
sections.explanation: 3/6 is equivalent to 1/2 because both fractions represent the same value - half of a whole. You can see this by dividing both numerator and denominator by 3.
